III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
(g) Peer-on-peer discipline or utilizing the assistance of another
youth to implement a restraint.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was discouraging another youth from going AWOL for an
hour without any supervision present to intervene. Youth assisted
in restraining the youth who was attempting to AWOL.
Investigation This complaint was received on 3/14/23 and jointly investigated
with the Government Worker. The complaint noted the following:
Youth A (17) and Youth B (15) are placed at Vista Maria. Youth
Specialist 1 is a staff member there. On 02/24/23, the youths
were in the gym for volleyball. There were four or five of the
youths that left the gym. Youth A was with Youth B who was trying
to run off campus. Youth A was restraining Youth B while Youth
Specialist 1 was on her phone. Youth Specialist 1 watched Youth
A restrain Youth B. Youth A was with Youth B outside for 45
minutes, while Youth Specialist 1 watched.
Complainant, who is also the assigned Foster Care Worker, was
interviewed via telephone on 3/14/23 and reported they had no
further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth A refused to
talk about the incident and indicated she wanted to "just drop it".
She reported we were making a big deal about something that she
doesn't want to talk about. She began to cry and said she was
worried staff would get in trouble. Youth A demanded we tell her
who else we were going to interview. Youth A said that Youth B
had her head bashed into the wall during the incident and she saw
it but refused to report who bashed in Youth B's head. The
interview was ended as Youth A refused to talk anymore about the
incident.
2

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/23 in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth B reported she
was in the gym and said "everyone was in a fight" as they were
there to play volleyball and got into it with another group of youths.
Youth B said she was creeping up the stairs to leave campus
when Youth A and the volleyball coach ran after her. Youth B
reported that the volleyball coach chased her and tried to stop her
from leaving. Youth B reported she doesn't like the volleyball
coach and she was going to “slam the coach on her back” when
Youth A stopped her. Youth B reported Youth A kept telling her to
calm down. Youth B reported Youth Specialist 1 "grabbed me and
hugged me and I don't remember any more". Youth B reported
Youth Specialist 1 hugged her from the side and Youth A was
there. Youth B then reported "I was in a real restraint" and “Youth
Specialist 2 and Supervisor 1 had me in a restraint.” Youth B
reported she was upset because they wouldn't let her run away.
Youth B denied that Youth A restrained her or held her in anyway.
Youth B reported there was staff around assisting during the
incident. Youth B reported that Youth Specialist 1 helped her
inside. Youth B could not remember if Youth Specialist 1 was on
the phone but indicated she might have been on the phone, but
she was watching Youth B. Youth B reported the restraint
occurred outside. Youth B did not report that her head was hurt in
any way.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/23
in collaboration with the Government Worker. Supervisor 1
reported that Youth C was fighting with another resident (name
unknown), and she got her out of the gym and then heard another
resident getting into it with that same unknown resident.
Supervisor 1 reported she got Youth C and two other residents
back to their building and then went back to the gym to assist with
getting more residents back to their buildings from the gym.
Supervisor 1 reported she saw Youth A and Youth B with Youth
Specialist 1 by the exit door. She reported they were talking with
Youth B as she was threatening to AWOL. Supervisor 1 reported
she was standing in front of the door attempting to block Youth B
who was bumping into her. Supervisor 1 reported she asked
Youth Specialist 1 to call a campus clear. A campus clear alerts all
available staff to come help. Team Leader 1 and Supervisor 2
came and assisted with Youth B. Team Leader 1 and Supervisor 1
were blocking Youth B and talking with her about making a safe
decision. Youth B became more aggressive and was placed in a
restraint for her own safety and the safety of others. Team Leader
1 knew Youth B from her past and he began to verbally de-
3

escalate Youth B. Supervisor 1 reported she kept quiet as Team
Leader 1 was doing a good job de-escalating Youth B and they
started letting go of her arms as she calmed. Supervisor 1
reported that Team Leader 1 then asked Youth B if she was ready
to go back to her unit and she said yes if he came also and would
continue to talk with her. Supervisor 1 reported Team Leader 1
returned Youth B to her unit and stayed until 9pm that evening.
Supervisor 1 denied that she ever saw Youth A restrain Youth B
or hug her. Supervisor 1 reported she is Youth Specialist 1's
supervisor and Youth Specialist 1 hurt her back trying to block
Youth B. Supervisor 1 reported Youth Specialist 1 did what she
was supposed to during the incident. Supervisor 1 reported she
did not see Youth Specialist 1 on the phone but indicated she
might have had her walkie talkie as they are to have it when they
leave with residents to go to the gym. Supervisor 1 reported they
had Youth B in a standing two person hold restraint for six
minutes.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 on 3/29/23 via the phone in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Supervisor 2 reported
a campus clear had been called and he got into a car and drove
around the grounds of the facility looking for any youth who were
attempting to truant. Supervisor 2 reported he saw Supervisor 1,
the volleyball coach, and Youth B inside the school building.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth B was standing in the corner by the
doors and staff appeared to be trying to verbally de-escalate
Youth B. Supervisor 2 reported he was not present when Youth B
was restrained. Supervisor 2 reported he did see Youth A
standing around the area and she appeared to be acting as peer
support to Youth B. Supervisor 2 denied seeing Youth A restrain
Youth B. Supervisor 2 reported the girls were not physically close
to one another and they never touched. Supervisor 2 reported he
saw Youth Worker 1 standing by Youth A. Supervisor 2 did not
see Youth Worker 1 on the phone.
Team Leader 1 was interviewed via phone with the Government
Worker on 4/7/23. Team Leader 1 had difficulty remembering this
incident as it was over two months ago. He reported that he can
remember being at the gym and two girls getting into an
altercation and the staff trying to get all the girls back to their units.
Team Leader 1 reported he came to assist when the campus clear
was called but he does not remember restraining Youth B. Team
Leader 1 reported he remembers talking with Youth B about not
going AWOL with Supervisor 1. Youth Leader 1 does not recall
Youth A restraining Youth B. Team Leader 1 does not remember
seeing any staff on the phone.
4

I attempted to interview Youth Specialist 1 in collaboration with the
Government Worker on 3/21/23 and 4/11/23 and she did not show
up to the scheduled interviews. On 4/13/23 I was informed by the
Rights Officer that Youth Specialist 1 resigned from her position.
Attempts to phone Youth Specialist 1 were made and her phone
was disconnected.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
Incident report dated 2/24/23 authored by Supervisor 1. Incident
report was consistent with staff and youth's interviews.
Analysis Based upon interviews there is no evidence that supports Youth B
was restrained by Youth A. None of the staff or youth interviewed
saw Youth A restrain Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was asked to lie regarding the incident and the incident
report was falsified.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 3/21/23 face to face at the facility in
collaboration with Government Worker. Youth A refused to talk
about the incident and asked for the investigation to be dropped.
Youth A did not report she was asked to lie about the incident.
Youth Specialist 1 was not able to be interviewed as she did not
show for two scheduled interviews and resigned from her position
during the course of the investigation. Youth Specialist 1’s phone
was disconnected, and she was unable to be contacted or
interviewed.
I spoke with Supervisor 1 via the phone on 4/18/23. Supervisor 1
authored the incident report completed on 2/24/23. Supervisor 1
reported the information in the incident report was accurate to the
events that happened that night. She denied falsifying the report
and denied ever speaking with Youth A about the report or asking
her to lie.
5

Analysis Based upon interviews and documentation reviewed there is no
evidence to support Supervisor 1 falsified the incident report or
that she asked Youth A to lie about the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
